episodeTitle: The Roaring Burn Bazooka! Luffy vs. War Demon Wyper!
description: Luffy battles Wyper, who unleashes his devastating Burn Bazooka attack. Meanwhile, Enel appears on the Going Merry and defeats both Usopp and Sanji while revealing his plans for the City of Gold. Hotori and Kotori, Satori's brothers, debut seeking revenge.

events.title: Luffy vs Wyper Battle Begins
events.description: Luffy engages in combat with Wyper, the fierce Shandia warrior known as the War Demon. Luffy tells Wyper that cannons and rifles won't work on him due to his rubber body.
events.significance: This establishes one of the key confrontations in the Skypiea Arc, showcasing Wyper as a formidable opponent who can challenge Luffy.

quotes.text: Cannons and rifles won't work on me!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy confidently declares his Devil Fruit immunity to Wyper

events.title: Burn Bazooka Debut
events.description: Wyper upgrades his weapon by adding a Flame Dial, creating the Burn Bazooka - a devastating fire-based attack that can harm even Luffy's rubber body. The white flames nearly incinerate Luffy, proving to be one of the most dangerous attacks he has faced in the Skypiea arc.
events.significance: This demonstrates the effectiveness of combining Dial technology with weaponry, and shows that Luffy can be harmed by fire-based attacks despite his rubber immunity to bullets and cannons.

events.title: Hotori and Kotori Debut
events.description: Hotori and Kotori, the twin brothers of Satori and lieutenants of the Divine Soldiers, make their first appearance. They arrive seeking revenge for their older brother Satori's defeat.
events.significance: Introduces new antagonists to the Skypiea conflict and expands the presence of God's Army forces.

events.title: Enel Arrives at the Going Merry
events.description: Enel appears on the Going Merry where Usopp, Sanji, Nami, and Gan Fall are located. His sudden arrival creates immediate tension as the crew realizes they must face the self-proclaimed god.
events.significance: This marks a critical turning point as Enel directly confronts members of the Straw Hat crew for the first time, demonstrating his overwhelming power.

events.title: Enel Reveals His Goal: The City of Gold
events.description: Enel announces that his true objective is to find and claim Shandora, the legendary City of Gold. This revelation shows that Enel shares the same treasure goal as both the Straw Hats and the Shandia people.
events.significance: This establishes the primary motivation behind Enel's actions and creates a three-way conflict over the ancient city's treasures and secrets.

quotes.text: My true goal is the City of Gold.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel reveals his objective to the crew on the Going Merry

events.title: Enel Attacks Sanji
events.description: Enel demonstrates his overwhelming power by instantly defeating Sanji with a single electrical attack. The cook is knocked unconscious before he can mount any defense.
events.significance: This establishes Enel as one of the most dangerous opponents the crew has faced, capable of instantly defeating a strong fighter like Sanji.

events.title: Usopp's Bluff: 8,000 Followers
events.description: In a desperate attempt to intimidate Enel, Usopp claims he has 8,000 followers who will avenge him if Enel doesn't leave. This is a callback to Usopp's recurring lie about having followers.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's characteristic cowardice and tendency to bluff when facing overwhelming opponents, while also foreshadowing his eventual truth of having followers.

quotes.text: I have 8,000 followers! If you don't leave now, I'll spare your life!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

events.title: Enel Defeats Usopp
events.description: Enel, upset by Usopp's lies and threats, uses his Goro Goro no Mi powers to electrocute Usopp, leaving him smoking and unconscious. The attack is devastating and appears to have killed Usopp.
events.significance: Shows Enel's merciless nature and establishes the grave danger the crew faces. Creates a moment of extreme tension as the crew believes Usopp may be dead.

events.title: Nami Checks Sanji's Heart
events.description: After Usopp cries over what appears to be Sanji's death, Nami points out that he was checking the wrong side. She explains that the heart is on the left side, and when Usopp checks correctly, he discovers Sanji is still alive.
events.significance: Provides comic relief in a tense moment and shows the crew's care for each other. Also highlights Usopp's panic leading to simple mistakes.

quotes.text: You were checking the wrong side! The heart is on the left!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Enel Leaves the Going Merry
events.description: After defeating Usopp and Sanji, Enel departs from the Going Merry. He leaves Hotori and Kotori behind to deal with Nami and Gan Fall.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming battle between Nami/Gan Fall and the twin brothers while Enel pursues his own goals.

events.title: Yama vs Genbo Battle
events.description: Genbo, a Shandia warrior, confronts Yama, the commander of the Divine Soldiers. Despite Genbo's determination and cannonball attacks, Yama demonstrates surprising agility for his large size.
events.significance: Shows the ongoing conflict between the Shandia warriors and God's Army forces, establishing Yama as a formidable opponent.

events.title: Axe Mountain Technique Debut
events.description: Yama unveils his devastating Ten-Fold Axe: Axe Mountain attack, using a sash with ten Axe Dials sewn onto it. He augments his belly drop with cutting damage, decisively defeating Genbo and leaving X-shaped marks on the terrain.
events.significance: Demonstrates the versatility and power of Dial technology when used by skilled fighters, and establishes Yama's combat prowess.

events.title: Luffy and Wyper's Simultaneous Attack
events.description: Luffy and Wyper both launch powerful bazooka-like attacks at each other simultaneously. The collision of their attacks results in both fighters being thrown apart from each other.
events.significance: Shows that Luffy and Wyper are evenly matched in combat, with neither gaining a decisive advantage.

events.title: Wyper Decides Not to Kill Luffy
events.description: After their intense battle, Wyper decides it would be better not to kill Luffy and instead save his energy to fight and kill Enel, his true target. This shows Wyper's strategic thinking and priority.
events.significance: Reveals Wyper's true motivation and hatred for Enel, while also showing he recognizes Luffy is not his real enemy. This decision has lasting implications for their relationship.

events.title: Luffy Falls into Underground Ruins
events.description: Just as Luffy is about to respond to Wyper, he is swallowed by a giant python and falls into the underground ruins beneath Upper Yard. Wyper is left wondering where Luffy disappeared to.
events.significance: Separates Luffy from Wyper and sends him on a path to discover the ancient secrets hidden beneath Skypiea, advancing the archaeological mystery subplot.

events.title: Chopper Encounters Gedatsu
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper encounters Gedatsu, one of Enel's priests known as the Sky Boss. Gedatsu comically struggles to locate Chopper due to his eyes being rolled back in his head, creating a humorous moment.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming Chopper vs Gedatsu battle in the next episode while showcasing Gedatsu's comedic incompetence despite being a dangerous priest.

events.title: Nami and Gan Fall Prepare for Battle
events.description: With Usopp and Sanji defeated and Enel departed, Nami and Gan Fall steel themselves to fight Hotori and Kotori, who have been left behind to finish them off.
events.significance: Sets up the battle that will continue in the next episode, showing Nami and Gan Fall's courage in the face of powerful enemies.

quotes.text: Cannons and rifles won't work on me!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy confidently declares his Devil Fruit immunity to Wyper

quotes.text: My true goal is the City of Gold.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel reveals his objective to the crew on the Going Merry

quotes.text: I have 8,000 followers! If you don't leave now, I'll spare your life!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

quotes.text: You were checking the wrong side! The heart is on the left!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami corrects Usopp's panicked mistake when checking if Sanji is alive

themes.description: The episode showcases overwhelming power through both Wyper's Burn Bazooka and especially Enel's effortless defeat of Sanji and Usopp, establishing the god-like threat level Enel represents.
themes.symbolism: Enel's lightning represents absolute power and divine judgment, while his casual defeat of strong fighters shows the vast gap between him and the crew.

themes.description: Characters face seemingly impossible odds but continue to fight or stand their ground. Usopp's bluff, Wyper's strategic thinking, and Nami and Gan Fall's preparation to fight all show different forms of courage.
themes.symbolism: The underground ruins symbolize hidden depths and secrets yet to be revealed, while the simultaneous attacks by Luffy and Wyper represent mutual respect between warriors.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the unique Dial technology of Skypiea, showing how it can be weaponized in creative ways through Wyper's Burn Bazooka and Yama's Axe Mountain technique.

characterSpotlights.development: Enel's overwhelming power is fully displayed as he effortlessly defeats two Straw Hat crew members while revealing his ultimate goal of finding the City of Gold. His god complex and merciless nature are emphasized.
keyActions: Reveals plan to find the City of Gold
Leaves Hotori and Kotori to finish the job
quotes: My true goal is the City of Gold.

characterSpotlights.development: Wyper demonstrates his combat prowess and strategic mind by upgrading his weapon to the Burn Bazooka and deciding to spare Luffy to save energy for fighting Enel. His true priorities are revealed.
keyActions: Decides not to kill Luffy to save energy for Enel

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces one of his toughest opponents in Wyper and experiences the danger of fire-based attacks. His battle is interrupted when he falls into the underground ruins, setting up new discoveries.
keyActions: Fights Wyper using his Gomu Gomu techniques
Nearly gets incinerated by the Burn Bazooka
Exchanges simultaneous bazooka attacks with Wyper
Falls into underground ruins after being swallowed by giant python
quotes: Cannons and rifles won't work on me!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's characteristic cowardice and bluffing are on full display as he tries to intimidate Enel with lies about followers. He suffers a devastating defeat, creating a moment of extreme danger.
keyActions: Witnesses Enel's arrival and Sanji's defeat
Attempts to bluff Enel with claims of 8,000 followers
Gets electrocuted and defeated by Enel
Mistakenly checks wrong side for Sanji's heartbeat
quotes: I have 8,000 followers! If you don't leave now, I'll spare your life!

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 171 skips Chapter 261 pages 12-14, which are instead adapted in Episode 172. This creates a slightly different pacing for the Chopper and Gedatsu encounter.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 260 (pages 2-17) and Chapter 261 (pages 2-11 and 15-19), making it one of the episodes with selective chapter coverage.
The Burn Bazooka is created by combining a standard bazooka with a Flame Dial, demonstrating the versatility of Dial technology in combat.
Hotori and Kotori are identical twin brothers who work as lieutenants under Yama in the Divine Soldiers. They both stand 179 cm tall and have Birkan wings.

sources.title: Hotori and Kotori - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Usopp's claim of having 8,000 followers is a recurring lie that eventually becomes truth when he gains a following in Dressrosa as 'God Usopp'.
The ending theme 'A to Z' by ZZ was used for episodes 169-181, spanning the middle portion of the Skypiea Arc.

sources.title: A to Z - One Piece Wiki
